intro: Dukea euryphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved dukea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant has large, broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along stream banks or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
